comment: Tal's favorite opening.
The Caro-Kann defense.
Controlling the center.
Fighting back in the center.
Developing a piece and protecting the pawn on e4.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7
comment: So that after 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6 Black can recapture with 6... Nxf6 rather than gxf6. 4... Bf5 is more usual.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3
comment: A natural developing move.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+
comment: Better to exchange than retreat.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6
comment: as planned.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4
comment: The bishop is placed in an aggressive position.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5
comment: Developing the bishop before it is blocked by a pawn on e6.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2
comment: White plans to castle queenside in the near future.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6
comment: Blocking White's bishop and preparing to develop his own.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5
comment: Pinning the knight and preparing to castle.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7
comment: Breaking the pin.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6
comment: 10... Nd5 may have turned out better.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4
comment: Hoping to exchange the bishops and castle.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4
comment: Now if 12... Bxh4 then 13. gxf5 Nxf2 14. fxe6 fxe6 15. Nxh4 Qxh4 16. Rhe1 Nxd1 17. Qxe6+ Kd8 18. Qd6+ Kc8 19. Be6#.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3
comment: So as to be able to play 14... Qc7 and 15... 0-0-0 getting the king to safety.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3
comment: It is normally better to capture toward the center (hxg3) but White wants the f file open.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7
comment: Black would like to castle queenside next move.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5
comment: Now if 15... 0-0-0 then 16. Nxf7

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6
comment: Protecting f7 with the queen.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4
comment: Making 16... 0-0 dangerous. Black still can't play 16... 0-0-0 because17. Nxf7 Qxf7 18. Bxe6+ wins the queen. If 16... Bxe5 17. dxe5 Black cannot play 0-0-0 because of the rook on the open d file.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6
comment: Once the knight is chased away Black will finally be able to castle.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6
comment: Easier said then done! White gives up the knight to keep the Black king in the center.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5
comment: If Black plays 18... Bxe5 then 19. Rhe1 Bxg3 20. Bd7+ Kf8 (20... Kd8 21. Qe8+ Rxe8 22. Rxe8#.) 21. Qe7+ Kg8 22. Be6#.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5 Be7 19. Rhf1
comment: Threatening 10. Bf7+. Did Tal see this position when he captured the knight with the f pawn?

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5 Be7 19. Rhf1 Rf8 20. Rxf8+ Bxf8 21. Qf3
comment: Threatening 22. Rd7.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5 Be7 19. Rhf1 Rf8 20. Rxf8+ Bxf8 21. Qf3 Qe7
comment: So if 24. Rd7 then 24... Qxe6.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5 Be7 19. Rhf1 Rf8 20. Rxf8+ Bxf8 21. Qf3 Qe7 22. Qb3
comment: Threatening 25. Bd7+ Qxd7 26. Rxd7 Kxd7 27. Qxb7+ Ke8 28. Qxh8+

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5 Be7 19. Rhf1 Rf8 20. Rxf8+ Bxf8 21. Qf3 Qe7 22. Qb3 Rb8 23. Bd7+ Qxd7
comment: Black will have a rook and 2 bishops for the queen. This is normally more than enough for the queen but Black's position is too shaky to survive.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5 Be7 19. Rhf1 Rf8 20. Rxf8+ Bxf8 21. Qf3 Qe7 22. Qb3 Rb8 23. Bd7+ Qxd7 24. Rxd7 Kxd7 25. Qf7+
comment: Black will not be able to protect all his pieces.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5 Be7 19. Rhf1 Rf8 20. Rxf8+ Bxf8 21. Qf3 Qe7 22. Qb3 Rb8 23. Bd7+ Qxd7 24. Rxd7 Kxd7 25. Qf7+ Be7 26. e6+
comment: If 28... Kd6 then Qf4+ wins the rook.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. Bxe6 fxe5 18. dxe5 Be7 19. Rhf1 Rf8 20. Rxf8+ Bxf8 21. Qf3 Qe7 22. Qb3 Rb8 23. Bd7+ Qxd7 24. Rxd7 Kxd7 25. Qf7+ Be7 26. e6+ Kd8 27. Qxg7
comment: Black's position is crumbling.

moves: 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+ Nxf6 7. Bc4 Bf5 8. Qe2 e6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. O-O-O h6 11. Bh4 Ne4 12. g4 Bh7 13. Bg3 Nxg3 14. fxg3 Qc7 15. Ne5 Bd6 16. h4 f6 17. comment: forking the rook and bishop. Black resigned last move.
